summary: This document is an affidavit from AT&T's Custodian of Records, Daniel Reller, authenticating AT&T subscriber and call detail records for a phone number associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein. It includes a cover sheet from Cingular Wireless (later AT&T) responding to a 2006 legal request and a detailed phone bill for Epstein's account from May 2004. This document is a detailed AT&T wireless phone bill for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account, covering voice usage from April 3 to April 16, 2004. It shows numerous calls to and from locations including New York, Palm Beach, and international numbers, providing a log of communication patterns during this period. This document is a detailed AT&T wireless phone bill for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account, covering voice call activity from April 17-27, 2004. It shows numerous calls to and from locations including New York, Palm Beach, Florida, France, and Brazil, indicating extensive communication patterns and travel. This document is an AT&T Wireless invoice for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account (0043811863) for May 2004. It details extensive voice call logs, roaming usage (including calls to/from Brazil and Belgium), data usage, and text messages over a period from early April to early May 2004, showing a high volume of communication primarily to/from New York, Florida, and international locations.

persons.name: Daniel Reller
persons.role: Compliance Security Analyst and Custodian of Records for AT&T
persons.context: He provides a sworn affidavit verifying the authenticity of AT&T phone records, including those for Jeffrey E. Epstein's account, for use in a legal proceeding.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose phone account is detailed in this billing record, showing extensive call activity to various domestic and international locations.

connections.description: Reller, as AT&T's Custodian of Records, is authenticating and providing the phone records for Epstein's account in response to a legal request.

events.title: Legal Request for Phone Records
events.description: A legal request (File Code 227815) was made to Cingular Wireless/AT&T for call detail records.

events.title: Cingular Wireless Response
events.description: Cingular Wireless National Compliance Center responded to the legal request, providing call detail records for four target numbers from January 1, 2004, onward.

events.title: Affidavit of Authenticity
events.description: Daniel Reller of AT&T signed an affidavit verifying the authenticity of the provided phone records, including those for Jeffrey Epstein's number.

events.title: Epstein Phone Activity Period
events.description: Timeframe covered by the detailed wireless phone bill showing hundreds of calls and message retrievals.

events.title: Phone Call Activity Period
events.description: Detailed record of incoming and outgoing phone calls from Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T wireless account, showing high frequency of calls to locations including New York, Florida, France, and Brazil.

events.title: International Roaming Calls to Brazil
events.description: Multiple calls were made to or from Brazil while the phone was roaming in the U.S. Virgin Islands (CHTAMSTTHS VI).

events.title: International Roaming Calls to Belgium
events.description: Calls were made to or from Belgium while the phone was roaming.

events.title: High-Frequency Phone Activity
events.description: The invoice shows an extremely high volume of calls, often back-to-back, primarily to/from New York, NY, Morristown, NJ, Brooklyn, NY, and West Palm Beach, FL.

keyFacts: An AT&T custodian of records provided a sworn affidavit in 2021 authenticating phone records for a number associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The underlying records were produced in 2006 in response to a legal request (File Code 227815) to Cingular Wireless.
A detailed May 2004 phone bill for Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T account (number 917-855-3363) shows extensive usage, including international dialing and messaging services.
The document establishes a chain of custody and authentication for Epstein's phone records for use as evidence.
The document is a detailed AT&T wireless bill for Jeffrey Epstein's account number 0043811863, dated May 5, 2004.
It shows extensive phone activity between April 3-16, 2004, with hundreds of calls to/from New York, Palm Beach, and other locations.
International calls were made to/from France, the United Kingdom, and the U.S. Virgin Islands (Christsted).
Frequent 'message retrieval' events suggest checking voicemail regularly.
The bill shows calls to toll-free numbers and various U.S. cities, indicating broad communication patterns.
Jeffrey Epstein's phone bill shows extensive call activity between April 17-27, 2004, with calls to/from New York, Florida, France, and Brazil.
The document includes international calls to France and Brazil, suggesting Epstein maintained international communications during this period.
Multiple calls are shown to/from West Palm Beach, Florida - a location central to Epstein's activities.
The billing record shows both incoming and outgoing calls with detailed timestamps and duration information.
The account is explicitly listed under 'JEFFREY E EPSTEIN' with account number 0043811863, billed by AT&T Wireless.
The phone records show Jeffrey Epstein was in the U.S. Virgin Islands (roaming location CHTAMSTTHS VI) in early April 2004, making and receiving international calls to Brazil and Belgium.
There is an exceptionally high frequency of calls, with dozens of calls per day, often lasting only 1-2 minutes, suggesting frequent, short communications.
Primary call destinations are concentrated in New York City (multiple boroughs), New Jersey (Morristown), and Florida (West Palm Beach).
The document is a standard telecom invoice, evidencing Epstein's personal communication patterns and travel during this period.
The records include data usage and text messages, though those details are less granular than the voice call log.
